result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan J Paxton appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Gillion Parham in court for Ryan J Paxton.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing regarding defendants request for prompt disposition.  Defense has contacted the state for purposes of negotiations and hasn't heard back from them.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Defendant is serving a revocation that expires on 10/24/2022 and was just sentenced in Milwaukee county with an anticipated release date of March 2025; Colloquy between Court and counsel regarding need to have defendant remanded into the custody of the Washington County Jail due to request for prompt disposition and pursuant to statute. 
 Recess, Reconvene; Defendant withdraws request for prompt disposition; Court questions defendant and accepts waiver.  Defendant to appear by Zoom for the adjourned hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
AMENDED NOTICE:  Per request of Atty. Parham, hearing scheduled for 9-29-2022 at 1:30 p.m. via Zoom video from Stanley Correctional.
Per request of Atty. Parham, hearing scheduled for 0-29-2022 at 10:30 a.m. to allow her additional time for discussion with defendant.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety. No contact with co-defendant S.D.
Absolute sobriety; No contact with Co-Def SD; No controlled substances without a valid prescription; Bond faxed to Stanley Corr Inst 8/16/22

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via video in custody from Stanley Correctional without counsel.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court informs defendant of State Public Defender contact number.  Defendant has a case pending in Milwaukee County 20-CF-3347.  Court sets $500 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for a position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
7-21-2022 Initial appearance rescheduled to 8-15-2022 at 2:30 p.m. via Zoom from Stanley Correctional.
7-21-2022 Initial appearance to be rescheduled as defendant was picked up on a writ for court in Milwaukee County and is no longer available via video for the hearing in Washington County.
Arrangements made for defendant to appear by video from Stanley Correctional
Initial appearance on July 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
